Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.read_root()¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The newly created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves contacts with the specified birthday for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

a list of contacts with specified birthday.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The contact with the specified ID, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Note | None

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contacts]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The removed contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact| None

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(query: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves contacts with the specified name or email for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The filter of the contact to retrieve.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

a list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single note with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the note to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – The updated data for the contact.

  • user (User) – The user to update the contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated contact, or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirms the user’s email address in the database and saves this change.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – A string representing the user’s email address to be confirmed.

  • db (Session) – Session for interacting with the database.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a new user in the database based on the provided UserModel data.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – An instance of UserModel containing data for the new user.

  • db (Session) – Session for interacting with the database.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieves a user by their email address from the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – A string representing the email address of the user to search for.

  • db (Session) – Session for interacting with the database.

Returns:

A user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates the user’s avatar in the database based on their email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – A string representing the user’s email address for which to update the avatar.

  • url (str) – A string representing the new avatar URL.

  • db (Session) – Session for interacting with the database.

Returns:

The updated user object.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates the refresh token for a user in the database.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – A User object for which to update the token.

  • token (str | None) – A string representing the new refresh token. It can be None.

  • db (Session) – Session for interacting with the database.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Create a new contact with rate limiting.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The contact data to create.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Get a specific contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to retrieve.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The requested contact.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Get a list of contacts for the current user with rate limiting.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[ResponseContact]

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_query(query: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Search for contacts based on a query string.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – The search query.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

List of matching contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Remove a specific contact by ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The removed contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.routes.contacts.search_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Search for upcoming birthdays among the user’s contacts.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Update a specific contact by ID.

  • body (ContactModel) – The contact data to update.

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

The updated contact.

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

Parameters:

current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

Returns:

User details.

Return type:

User

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Update the user’s avatar with a new image file.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The uploaded image file for the new avatar.

  • current_user (User) – The currently authenticated user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

The updated user with the new avatar.

Return type:

User

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Confirm a user’s email address with a confirmation token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – The confirmation token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Confirmation response.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Authenticate a user and return an access token.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – The user login data.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Token response with access and refresh tokens.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Refresh an access token using a refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – The HTTP bearer token containing the refresh token.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Token response with a new access token and refresh token.

Return type:

TokenModel

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Request email confirmation for a user.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – The email request data.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – FastAPI background tasks for sending email confirmation.

  • request (Request) – The request object for accessing the base URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

User

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

Register a new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The user registration data.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – FastAPI background tasks for sending email confirmation.

  • request (Request) – The request object for accessing the base URL.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

User registration response.

Return type:

UserResponse

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

Generate a new access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – The data to encode into the token.

  • expires_delta (Optional[float]) – The expiration time for the token in seconds.

Returns:

The encoded access token.

Return type:

str

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=REDIS_HOST,port=0,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

Verify a user’s password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – The plain text password to verify.

  • hashed_password (str) – The hashed password to compare against.

Returns:

True if the passwords match, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Send an email for email verification to a user.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – The recipient’s email address.

  • username (str) – The user’s username.

  • host (str) – The host URL for email verification link.
